document.text:
From: 
To: 
Subject: RE: inmate interviews 
Date: Wed, 04 Dec 2019 17:40:31 +0000 
Embedded: Hammad_Memo_msg; 
Hammad_Memo_ 
Hammad_MemonEpstein_Death_Investigation.msg 
In most cases, we had the agents interview the inmates without counsel after doing a Hammad memo. I've attached a 
few examples. Where the inmate is a cooperator, we worked through the attorney. There were also two instances where 
an inmate was not a cooperator but we worked through the attorney because of the nature of the defendant (both were 
EDNY death eligible inmates). 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, December 4, 2019 12:24 PM 
To: 
Subject: inmate interviews 
I'm working on a Rikers investigation, and suggested I check with you to ask: for the MCC case, were you ever 
present for an uncounseled inmate interview, or did you guys just have agents do those interviews? He wasn't sure what 
the practice was. Thanks. 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
One Saint Andrew's Plaza 
New York, NY 10007 
EFTA00018130
